Hi @leedongyang 
any update? Did you encounter difficulties?
fixes by #15485
@mykioer Can you translate this issue to english? And provide more information.

Hi @ruoyang-pin 
Why do you say that, is there any more information?
@qing701 Tables without any sharding rules configured will be recognized as `singleTable`, when there is a `singleTable` with the same name, overwriting will occur
i‘v solved this problem.thank u
@lanchengx  thank you
@RaigorJiang I am too busy these days. I plan to deal with this issue this weekend.
the same with #14550
Hi @ynfeng, thank you for your feedback. I'm not familiar with flywaydb, can you dig into the code to see what caused the exception? Or provide steps to reproduce the problem?

Here is the configuration snippet, hope this information is useful

[config.txt](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/files/8095651/config.txt)

In class org.apache.shardingsphere.driver.jdbc.core.datasource.metadata.ShardingSphereDatabaseMetaData line 57, the dataSourcesMetaData was null.
![20220218170208](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7802558/154651598-74755e45-dd61-4ab4-93d8-dc69c5c3d8ba.jpg)

@leedongyang 
Well, no hurry, you can enjoy the process.

Oh, I found the problem. The config in yaml dosen't support this format.
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7802558/154655829-83a862a2-4bb9-4be7-9cb9-277aa4419dd5.jpg)
but this is ok.
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7802558/154655877-f89ebbae-56cd-4d01-ba73-c9ce8f5a9cf9.jpg)

Yes, it's forbidden to alter some sharding rule, since the underlying data is not migrated, if we alter sharding rule, it might cause issue (rule is not consistent with underlying data sharding).
Related issue is #14719.
Maybe the error message should be updated, then it's more clear for users to understand it.

Hi @sandynz 
If the user does not need to use the scaling feature, or has created a sharding rule and has not written data yet, should scaling be configured before it can be used? This looks a little confusing

> Hi @sandynz If the user does not need to use the scaling feature, or has created a sharding rule and has not written data yet, should scaling be configured before it can be used? This looks a little confusing

Yes, it could be improved.

If there already has underlying data and to be altered rule would change data sharding, then scaling feature is necessary.
Else, the limit could be passed, but solution is unknown for now. Solution should be different after metadata multi-version is ready.
I'll disable the exception for now, until metadata multi-version and solution is ready.

> Oh, I found the problem. The config in yaml dosen't support this format. ![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7802558/154655829-83a862a2-4bb9-4be7-9cb9-277aa4419dd5.jpg) but this is ok. ![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7802558/154655877-f89ebbae-56cd-4d01-ba73-c9ce8f5a9cf9.jpg)

Yes, The second way are right. It 's not support first way.

> I'll disable the exception for now, until metadata multi-version and solution is ready.

I am agree with you.

Already fixed by version 5.1.0.
